meanings.definition: Force (something unwelcome or unfamiliar) to be accepted or put in place.
meanings.sent1: The teacher imposed a new homework assignment on the students.
meanings.sent2: The government imposed a curfew to control the spread of the virus.
meanings.sent3: The cat imposed its presence on the dog's favorite spot.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds imposed a sense of gloom over the city.
meanings.sent5: The strict teacher imposed strict rules on the classroom.

meanings.sent1: She imposed her unwanted opinions on the group.
meanings.sent2: The bully imposed his will on the weaker kids.
meanings.sent3: The noisy neighbor imposed their loud music on the entire building.
meanings.sent4: The harsh winter imposed its freezing temperatures on the town.
meanings.sent5: The strict parent imposed strict discipline on their children.

meanings.definition: Establish or apply (a rule or law).
meanings.sent1: The company imposed a new dress code for all employees.
meanings.sent2: The judge imposed a heavy fine on the defendant.
meanings.sent3: The prankster imposed a silly rule on their friends for a day.
meanings.sent4: The artist imposed their unique style on the painting.
meanings.sent5: The leader imposed strict regulations on the community.
